bioghist.p: Constantine Hering is considered the "father of homeopathy in America." He founded the Allentown Academy, the world's first school of homeopathic medicine and went on to found Homeopathic Medical College of Pennsylvania and its successor, Hahnemann Medical College of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: Letters, papers, photographs, personal and medical memorabilia of Hering and his family. Includes the class notes of Hering's son-in-law and biographer, Calvin Knerr, a Hahnemann graduate whose family contributed much of the collection material.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
